item.title: GUI Revamp Brainstorming Thread
item.dc:creator: @BitBay_Guy BitBay Guy
item.description:
@BitBay_Guy wrote:

With the upcoming GUI revamp, it’s time to ask ourselves important questions. What sort of improvements will make the BitBay market as usable as possible for the average Joe? What sort of workflow will be most easily adjusted to when switching from other markets such as Amazon or eBay? Are there any features that are redundant or can be removed from the client to make things more simple? What additional features can be implemented, and how would they be added to the current user interface? etc.

If you have not yet tried using the BitBay Market Client, please give it a whirl and get back to us! I will be posting my own views on this topic shortly.

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic

item.title: Suggestion: Recommended/suggested DDE amounts to enhance user adoption
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

Have a little suggestion

Been running through DDE scenarios in my head, and was thinking that newbies might be a little confused at first as to what amount each deposit should be set at. How difficult would it be to set up a dynamic “recommended” DDE amount that changes based on the product/services value, both user’s reputation and each party’s risk tolerance

…could also factor in user account balances and recommend using the actual item or service as collateral if one party cannot meet deposit requirements

(similar to password strength recommendations when creating new internet accounts etc.)

of course still allowing custom/manual tailoring if desired too…

Posts: 2

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: Suggestion: Recommended/suggested DDE amounts to enhance user adoption
